techmeme.title: Apple touts its device longevity in a whitepaper and says True Tone and battery health data will be available for third-party replacement parts later in 2024 (Chris Welch/The Verge)
Sources: an ID verification service that handles ID photos and is used by TikTok, X, Uber, and others, left admin credentials exposed online for over a year (Joseph Cox/404 Media)
Formation Bio, which uses AI to co-develops drugs with biotech and pharma companies, raised a $372M Series D led by a16z, bringing its total funding to $600M+ (Kyle Wiggers/TechCrunch)
SCOTUS declines to impose limits on the way the Biden administration may communicate with social media platforms, overturning a lower court's 2023 decision (Andrew Chung/Reuters)
Meta says "an error" is causing Instagram and Threads to turn on a setting that limits political content from people who users don't follow, upon every app open (Gaby Del Valle/The Verge)
